name: Introductory Physics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of physics. Students will learn about mechanics, thermodynamics, waves, optics, electromagnetism, and atomic physics.

name: Introductory Astronomy
description: This course introduces students to the principles of Astronomy. Students will learn about the structure and formation of stars, galaxies and the universe, solar system, celestial mechanics, and a general overview of astronomical phenomena.

name: Introductory Calculus
description: This course introduces students to the principles of calculus. Students will learn about functions, derivatives, integrals, and applications of calculus.

name: Classical Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of classical mechanics. Students will learn about kinematics, Newton’s laws of motion, conservation laws, oscillations, and gravitation.

name: Stellar Astrophysics
description: This course focuses on the structure, formation, and evolution of stars. Students will learn about the physical processes occurring within the star, including nuclear fusion, energy transport, and stellar atmospheres and interiors.

name: Introductory Programming
description: This course introduces students to the principles of programming and basic concepts in computer science. Students will learn basic syntax, control structures, data types, and algorithms to solve simple problems.

name: Cosmology
description: This course provides an overview of the universe on a large scale. Students will learn about the large-scale structure of the universe, the geometry of the universe, dark matter and dark energy, inflation, and the cosmic microwave background.

name: Quantum Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of quantum mechanics. Students will learn about wave-particle duality, Heisenberg's uncertainty principle, the Schrödinger equation, quantum states and operators, and quantum mechanical systems.

name: Planetary Science
description: This course focuses on the geology, meteorology, and formation of planets. Students will learn about the physical processes occurring on rocky, icy, and gas giant planets, their moons, and comets.

name: Astrophysics
description: This course focuses on the application of physics to astronomy. Students will learn about the properties of radiation, the principles of spectroscopy, black holes, neutron stars, pulsars, and gravitational waves.
